item.title: Re: arena
item.content:encoded: Its possible to lose to your shadow, if the range is quite high.

item.title: Re: arena
item.content:encoded:
of course you can lose against your shadow, but if you have enough strength that all of your rolls are successes, your shadow does the same(since he has the same stats)—>tie
since there are no ties in the arena you win(just barely)
so try to get as much strength as possible if you can't beat your own shadow(if you already in a higher season and face your shadow more often you might be lucky/good enough to beat him anyway)

item.title: Re: arena
item.content:encoded: Also, I dont think it's possible to lose to your shadow. I've yet to lose, but I always win but barely, as it says.

item.title: Re: arena
item.content:encoded:
You want to face your shadow? Loop, and right after dayroll, as a Genin, do your arena fights. There are not many Genin to pit you against, and you "should" face yourself a couple of times.

Good luck.

item.title: Re: arena
item.content:encoded:
Nah… if that were true, every Season 3+ Sannin would be fighting their shadow every day.

If you want to fight your shadow, your best bet is to get to a higher Season. At Season 6, I fight my shadow about 4 times a day.

item.title: Re: arena
item.content:encoded: my little brother has like 1million jutsu exp and got his shadow twice….i have like 500 xp and got it none yet……mybe that might be the factor?

item.title: Re: arena
item.content:encoded: Just after looping, right after Dayroll as a Genin, do your Arena fight… You WILL encounter your Shadow if you are Season 2+

item.title: Re: arena
item.content:encoded: Higher Season and Rank means more chances of encountering your shadow.

item.title: Re: arena
item.content:encoded: You randomly run into your shadow in the arena. Just continue doing your arena battles and you will eventually run into it. It is supposed to be rare to run into your shadow so it may take awhile.
